title: Why is the goal of fire prevention to educate the public to take precautions to prevent potentially harmful? - Quora

response.answer_text: The grammar of your question is clumsy, but I think I understand. The best way to fight a fire is not to have one. Probably the scariest thing I ever saw was a house fire up close. It did $200,000 damage in 20 minutes and took 8 months to fix. Safety, in general, is a good idea - prevent losses. The old adage is “an ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure”.
